title: Distance to nearest vehicle
text:
ChartsData









This is an interactive analysis tool that computes vehicle similarity based on selected parameters. The data is generated dynamically based on your search criteria in the Charts tab above.
How it works: - Select target vehicle characteristics (make, type, price range) - The app identifies similar vehicles based on multiple attributes - View results as scatter plots or data tables - Adjust the number of similar vehicles to display

title: Vehicle Miles Traveled (VMT) by Age
text:
This page shows median cumulative vehicle miles traveled (VMT) by vehicle age. Each chart displays the 50th quantile (median) of total mileage for a given combination of powertrain and vehicle type as vehicles age over time. The “Data” tab shows the raw data, which also includes the 25th and 75th quantiles. Lines that are less smooth are the result of less data for that particular combination of powertrain and vehicle type. See the about page for more details.

title: About
text:
This dashboard analyzes over 10 million vehicle listings from 2018 to 2024, providing insights into how different powertrain types—gasoline, hybrid, and electric vehicles—are used, valued, and compete in the American automotive market.
Data from the vehicletrends open-source project (Dr. John Paul Helveston, George Washington University) using MarketCheck automotive listing data covering all 50 US states.

title: About
text:
Vehicle Miles Traveled (VMT)
The Daily VMT page shows the distribution of daily VMT across all vehicles in the dataset. Each chart displays quantiles of daily mileage for a given combination of powertrain and vehicle type. For example, the 0.5 quantile represents the median daily mileage (half of vehicles drive less than this amount and half drive more).
The VMT by Age page shows median cumulative vehicle miles traveled (VMT) by vehicle age. Each chart displays the 50th quantile (median) of total mileage for a given combination of powertrain and vehicle type as vehicles age over time.
For both of the VMT pages, we estimate mileage by computing quantiles of the odometer readings of vehicles listed in the used market. For the Daily VMT, we use all vehicles (regardless of age) and compute a detailed accounting of VMT for every quantile from 1 to 99. For VMT by age, we estimate the age of the vehicle as the listing date minus the production date, which we estimate as June 30 of the year previous to the model year (e.g., we estimate a 2020 model year vehicle was produced June 30, 2019).

title: About
text:
Depreciation
Examines how vehicles retain value over time across different powertrains. Shows the percentage of original price (MSRP) retained at each vehicle age, revealing which powertrains hold their value best and how quickly vehicles depreciate in their first 5 years.

title: About
text:
Market Concentration
Tracks market share and competitive dynamics across manufacturers within each powertrain category. Measures how concentrated or competitive each segment is, showing whether markets are dominated by a few manufacturers or have healthy competition across many brands.

title: About
text:
Listings
Detailed analysis of vehicle listings data, including pricing trends, availability, and inventory levels across different segments. Shows current market inventory patterns and pricing across vehicle types and powertrains.

title: About
text:
Dealerships Inventories
Explores dealership inventory patterns, stock levels, and geographic distribution of vehicle availability. Shows how dealer inventory is distributed across regions and vehicle types.

title: Daily Vehicle Miles Traveled (VMT)
text:
This page shows the distribution of daily vehicle miles traveled (VMT) across all vehicles in the dataset. Each chart displays quantiles of daily mileage for a given combination of powertrain and vehicle type. For example, the 0.5 quantile represents the median daily mileage (half of vehicles drive less than this amount and half drive more). See the about page for more details.

title: Welcome to vehicletrends.us!
text:
Welcome to vehicletrends.us!
This site is an ongoing project designed to make publicly available information about trends in the U.S. automotive market. The site pulls together a variety of data sources to reveal trends. See the about page for more details on the data sources and calculations.

title: Market Concentration
text:
ChartsDataAbout HHI

This section explains the Herfindahl-Hirschman Index (HHI) and its relevance to market concentration analysis.
See Understanding HHI for more details.
